info.description: Common Resources is the largest single domain and consists of two groupings. Common Resources are shared by all domains, allowing you to access and manipulate general employee data, user display profiles, business structures, the Control Center, the Transaction Assistant, and data aggregated across domains.
info.title: Common Resources I

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations on Access Control Points (ACPs). Access Control Points can correspond to general functions, such as Timecard and Schedule, or to individual options, such as birth dates or wage rates.

  • Function Access Hierarchy -- Suite functions and components are listed on the Function Access Profile pages and can be expanded to display the full hierarchy. Each function, or access control point, has only one parent point. For example, the Timekeeping Employee category is a parent to function areas such as Timestamp for Employee and functions in the timecard such as cancel meal deductions and comments. If you assign Allowed access rights to a parent function, access rights are allowed throughout the functional hierarchy.
  • Actions -- Access Control Points have an associated permission action. Actions are operations that employees can perform on the function. Access profiles can have Add, Edit, Delete, and View actions associated with an access control point.
  • Access Scope -- Access scopes define whether a user is allowed to perform an action. Access scopes include All, All but self, None, Allowed, and Disallowed. Various appears at the parent level when you do no set all child functions to Allow or Disallow.
tags.name: Access Control Points

tags.description: This resource allow you to retrieve and manipulate access method profiles, which allow you to more closely refine a user's experience based on how each user accesses the system.
tags.name: Access Method Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete average pay rate set objects, which describe the average pay rate set for a location on a date.
tags.name: Average Pay Rate Sets

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve the average pay rate for a location on a date.
tags.name: Average Pay Rates

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve employee biometric consent history data.
tags.name: Biometric Consent History

tags.description: This resource allows you to process a large data set that exceeds the UI display limit and return the output in CSV format.
tags.name: Bulk Downloads

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrive information about Comments as an employee or manager.
tags.name: Comments

tags.description: Common Resources is the largest single domain and consists of two groupings. Common Resources are shared by all domains, allowing you to access and manipulate general employee data, user display profiles, business structures, the Control Center, the Transaction Assistant, and data aggregated across domains.
tags.name: Common Resources I

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve information about Control Center profiles.
tags.name: Control Center Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows you to add, delete, or change cost center objects.

The cost center is an attribute on the business structure that allows work to be charged to the company's General Ledger.

When a cost center is assigned to a location, an employee's work inherits the cost center when the employee works in that location. Otherwise, cost centers are inherited from the parent. If a cost center is not associated with any parent, then the cost center from the lowest location level of the employeeâ€™s primary job is used.

You can also assign time to a specific cost center, for example when you need to charge work to the cost center of the employee's primary job or to another paying cost center.
tags.name: Cost Centers

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, read, update, and delete custom tiles.

Custom tiles provide admins and managers a way to integrate tiles from third party systems into the system dashboard.
tags.name: Custom Tiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate delegate profiles, which contain the list of persons used as delegates.
tags.name: Delegate Profiles

tags.description: The Device Groups resource allows you to retrieve all device group objects defined in the system.
tags.name: Device Groups

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete user display profiles. Use display profiles to configure and assign display preferences. Display profiles can be based on a job, department, or geographical location.
tags.name: Display Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and update domain event categories, which consist of system messages, leaves of absence, Timekeeping, myrequest, and so on.
tags.name: Domain Event Categories

tags.description: This resource provides a set of operations that allow you to retrieve and manipulate domain event navigations.
tags.name: Domain Event Navigations

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Domain Events and information associated with Domain Events.

A Service Limit applies to some of the bulk operations against this resource. Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.
tags.name: Domain Events

tags.description: This resource allows you to send dynamic event notifications.
tags.name: Dynamic Event Notifications

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and update employee groups.

An employee group defines the employees that are eligible to work for a manager. Employee groups include all home employees of the manager (employees whose primary job is in the specified organizational set) and all employees who are eligible to transfer (employees that can work a job in the specified organizational set).
tags.name: Employee Groups

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve employee photos based on person number or AOID and COID values.
tags.name: Employee Photos

tags.description: This resource helps to fetch the entitlement's summary and history details.
tags.name: Entitlements

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate feature switches, which allow you to enable and disable optional suite components.
tags.name: Feature Switches

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that facilitate the set up of fiscal periods.

A fiscal year calendar can start and end on any date that you define. Within each fiscal year, you select the type of fiscal period that you use for planning and analysis.
tags.name: Fiscal Calendars

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and delete Function Access Profiles and information associated with Function Access Profiles.

Function Access Profiles contain permissions to points in the hierarchy of functions, known as access control points (ACPs). The access control points can correspond to general functions, such as Timecard and Schedule, or to individual options, such as birth dates or wage rates.

  • Function Access Hierarchy -- Suite functions and components are listed on the Function Access Profile pages and can be expanded to display the full hierarchy. Each function, or access control point, has only one parent point. For example, the Timekeeping Employee category is a parent to function areas such as Timestamp for Employee and functions in the timecard such as cancel meal deductions and comments. If you assign Allowed access rights to a parent function, access rights are allowed throughout the functional hierarchy.
  • Actions -- Access control points have an associated permission action. Actions are operations that employees can perform on the function. Access profiles can have Add, Edit, Delete, and View actions associated with an access control point.
  • Access Scope -- Access scopes define whether a user is allowed to perform an action. Access scopes include All, All but self, None, Allowed, and Disallowed. Various appears at the parent level when you do no set all child functions to Allow or Disallow.
tags.name: Function Access Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate generic data access profiles.
tags.name: Generic Data Access Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Generic Notifications.

A Service Limit applies to some of the bulk operations against this resource. Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.
tags.name: Generic Notifications

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete Hours of Operation objects, which describe the schedule of work for a facility.
tags.name: Hours of Operation

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete hours of operation assignments in regular hours, each of which describes standard open and close times for each day of the week.
tags.name: Hours of Operation Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete hours of operation override assignments, which describe changes to standard hours of operation for a specific date, such as a holiday.
tags.name: Hours of Operation Override Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete hours of operation override objects, which describe changes to standard hours of operation for a specific date, such as a holiday.
tags.name: Hours of Operation Overrides

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Known IP Addresses. A Known IP Address is a whitelisted IP address.

IP whitelisting allows administrators to create and manage lists of IP ranges authorized to access the system. When this feature is enabled, only connections from IP addresses in the whitelists are able to connect to the system. IP addresses outside of the whitelist are blocked.
tags.name: Known IP Addresses

tags.description: This resource allows you to send and retrieve common messaging notifications.
tags.name: Messaging Notifications

tags.description: This operation returns the start and end dates and times for a pay period.
tags.name: Pay Period Timespans

tags.description:
This resource allows you to export payroll via a stream or asynchronously and retrieve details about asynchronous payroll export jobs.

Refer to the following topic for example calls and tutorials: [A Guide to Running Payroll](doc:a-guide-to-running-payroll-doc).
tags.name: Payroll Export

tags.description:
This resource allows you to stage payroll asynchronously and retrieve details about staged payroll jobs.

Refer to the following topic for more information, example calls, and tutorials: [A Guide to Running Payroll](doc:a-guide-to-running-payroll-doc).
tags.name: Payroll Staging

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate payroll and accrual tables.

Refer to the following topic for more information, example calls, and tutorials: [A Guide to Running Payroll](doc:a-guide-to-running-payroll-doc).
tags.name: Payroll Tables

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and modify Proactively Guide Employees (PGE) setup behaviors configuration.
tags.name: Proactively Guide Employees - Behaviors Configuration

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and modify Proactively Guide Employees (PGE) behaviors configuration items.
tags.name: Proactively Guide Employees - Behaviors Configuration Items

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate reviewer lists, which contain the list of persons used to review requests.
tags.name: Reviewer Lists

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, delete and update reviewer purposes.
tags.name: Reviewer Purposes

tags.description: This resource sends one or more  notifications for a given event to the intended recipient
tags.name: Send Event Notifications

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that facilitate the set up of symbolic periods.

Symbolic periods allow employees to enter values such as full day, which translates into the number of hours in an employee's shift.
tags.name: Symbolic Periods

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate symbolic purposes.

Symbolic purpose is a label with a predefined type that can be associated with a job, reviewer list, request subtype, or a rule in order to apply additional filtering logic. Symbolic purposes replace reviewer purposes.
tags.name: Symbolic Purposes

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve symbolic reviewers and listeners.
tags.name: Symbolic Reviewers and Listeners

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a list of the TeleTime IP User Profiles that are available for person assignment.
tags.name: TeleTime IP User Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve timecard approval methods.
tags.name: Timecard Approval Methods

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and set the system's timezone.
tags.name: Timezones

tags.description: This resource allows you to read transaction errors in import feeds from integrations, punch feeds from UDM, and configuration migrations from SDM.
tags.name: Transaction Assistant

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate transfer display profiles.

A transfer display profile defines which organizational node types an employee can view when searching for business structure jobs.
tags.name: Transfer Display Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate WiFi Access Points, which are defined as a named object with a BSSID. WiFi Access Points can also be associated with WiFi Networks. WiFi Networks are leveraged by Known Places as an additional mechanism through which a user can assert their location while geofenced.
tags.name: WiFi Access Points

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate WiFi Networks, which are defined as a named object with an ESSID. WiFi Networks can be associated with WiFi Access Points. WiFi networks are leveraged by Known Places as an additional mechanism through which a user can assert their location while geofenced.
tags.name: WiFi Networks

post.description:
This operation returns employee biometric consent history by object references.

The associated Access Control Point is UDM_BIOMETRIC_CONSENT_HISTORY.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of employees that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Employees__ cannot exceed 1,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

200.description: Successfully retrieved employee biometric consent history.

400.description:
• [UDM-00100] - An exception was encountered processing the request.
  • [UDM-00101] - Please provide a valid key. Options are: personid, personnumber, badgenumber
  • [UDM-00102] - Please provide valid values for the specified key.
  • [UDM-00103] - Please provide a valid multi_key. Options are: [ aoid ], [ aoid, coid ], [ coid, aoid ]
  • [UDM-00104] - Please provide valid multi_key_values for the specified multi_key pair.
  • [UDM-00105] - Please provide either a valid key or multi_key pair.
  • [UDM-00106] - Please provide either a valid key or valid multi_key pair, not both.
  • [UDM-00107] - You can only provide one type of filter criteria at a time. Either the employees or the Hyperfind filter.
  • [UDM-00110] - Please provide a valid multi_key. Include coid as it is required. Options are: [ aoid, coid ], [ coid, aoid ]
  • [WCO-101726] - You must provide a valid index {indexValue}.
  • [WCO-101727] - You must provide a valid count {countValue}.
  • [WCO-101338] - Supplied Count's value exceeds maximum allowed limit:{countLimit}.

403.description: Access rights violation: you do not have the required function access profile to perform this task.

The associated Access Control Point is DOWNLOADS.

post.description:
This operation creates or updates and returns a list of Generic Data Access Profiles.

The associated Access Control Point is GENERIC_DATA_ACCESS_PROFILE.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the total number of generic data access profiles and the number of generic data access profiles times the number of setup items that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Generic Data Access Profiles__ cannot exceed 5.

* The __Number of Generic Data Access Profiles__ multiplied by the __Number of Setup Items__ cannot exceed 200.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

post.description:
This operation returns a list of all new or reviewed notifications according to the access privileges of the logged-in user. Notifications are further filtered according to the provided category for the selected timeframe or based on the person IDs contained in the specified Hyperfind.

The associated Access Control Point is NOTIFICATION_API_V1.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the total number of notifications returned and the number of notifications returned in each paginated response page.

* The __Total Number of Notifications__ cannot exceed 50,000.

* The __Number of Notifications in Each Page__ cannot exceed 1,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

## Details

The `types` array accepts the following values:

| type                                                       | domain     |
|:----------------                                           | --------:  |
| ATTENDANCE                                                 | attendance |
| HCA_TRANSACTIONAL_DATA_PROCESS                             | HCA        |
| AUDITOR_RUN                                                | KPIF       |
| KPI_Historical_Load                                        | KPIF       |
| LEAVE                                                      | leave      |
| LEAVE_REQUEST                                              | leave      |
| DATE_BASED_NOTIFICATION                                    | leave      |
| LIMIT_BASED_NOTIFICATION                                   | leave      |
| DOCUMENT_REMINDER                                          | leave      |
| ANNOUNCEMENTS                                              | platform   |
| PROACTIVELY_GUIDE_EMPLOYEES                                | platform   |
| Integration_Completed                                      | platform   |
| Integration_Started                                        | platform   |
| Reference_Table_Upload_Completed                           | platform   |
| Reference_Table_Upload_Failed                              | platform   |
| Integration_Completed_Notification                         | platform   |
| SCHEDULEREPORT                                             | reporting  |
| VisibilityPeriod                                           | scheduler  |
| PostSchedule                                               | scheduler  |
| UnPostSchedule                                             | scheduler  |
| RepostAfterEdit                                            | scheduler  |
| FILL_OPEN_SHIFT                                            | scheduler  |
| FILL_OPEN_SHIFT_OUTCOME                                    | scheduler  |
| INACTIVE_REQUEST                                           | scheduler  |
| NOTIFY_MY_COLLEAGUES                                       | scheduler  |
| TIME_OFF                                                   | scheduler  |
| AVAILABILITY_REQUEST                                       | scheduler  |
| TIMECARD_CHANGE_REQUEST                                    | scheduler  |
| AVAILABILITY_PATTERN_REQUEST                               | scheduler  |
| OPEN_SHIFT                                                 | scheduler  |
| SELF_SCHEDULE                                              | scheduler  |
| COVER                                                      | scheduler  |
| SWAP                                                       | scheduler  |
| EMP_MEAL_BREAK_OVERTIME                                    | timekeeper |

| TIMECARD_REQUEST_REVIEW                                    | timekeeper |

| Timekeeping                                                | timekeeper |

get.description:
This resource returns a pay period timespan based on the pay period ID, pay rule ID, user, date, and period type. The system supports the following parameter combinations:

  • pay_period_id returns the pay period timespan for the specified pay period ID.
  • pay_rule_id returns the pay period timespan for the specified pay rule ID.
  • user returns the current pay period timespan for the specified user ID.
  • date returns the pay period timespan for the specified date for the current logged-in user.
  • user specified in conjunction with date returns the pay period timespan for the specified user and date.
  • period_type can be specified as Previous, Current, or Next to return the appropriate pay period timespan.
  • period_type can be specified in conjunction with user_id, pay_period_id, or pay_rule_id.
  • If no parameter is specified, this resource returns the current pay period for the current logged-in user.
  • If other parameter combinations are specified, the system considers the parameters in the following order:
    1. pay period id
    2. pay rule id
    3. user
    4. date

parameters.description: The Pay Period ID associated with a pay period timespan request.
parameters.name: pay_period_id

parameters.description: The Pay Rule ID associated with a pay period timespan request.
parameters.name: pay_rule_id

parameters.description: An ID that uniquely identifies an employee associated with a pay period timespan. This is not a person number.
parameters.name: employee_id

parameters.description: The date associated with a pay period timespan for the currently logged-in user.
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: The period type, specified as Previous, Current, or Next to return the appropriate pay period timespan.
parameters.name: period_type

parameters.description: The Time Zone identifier associated with a pay period timespan request.
parameters.name: time_zone_id

400.description:
Bad request:

  • [WCO-124000] - Invalid employee id {empId}
  • [WCO-124001] - Invalid pay rule id {payRuleId}
  • [WCO-124002] - Invalid date {date}
  • [WCO-124003] - Invalid period type {periodType}
  • [WCO-124004] - Pay period should fall under current year.
  • [WCO-124007] - Invalid time zone id {timeZoneId}
  • [WTK-180150] - Pay Rule does not exist or accessed with a bad reference.
  • [WTK-180151] - Unexpected exception occurs while fetching payrule data.
  • [WTK-180152] - Data validation exception occurs due to bad input data while request processing. Please verify input data.
  • commonbusiness.timeframe.error.timeframe5153 : Unable to find span details.Please check parameters are passed correctly.
  • commonbusiness.timezone.error.timezone5100 : Some unexpectable error is occured. Please check System logs or contact System Administrator.
  • commonbusiness.timezone.error.timezone5101 : Invalid API parameter/s are received. Please check passed parameters are valid.
  • commonbusiness.timezone.error.timezone5103 : Null parameters are received.
  • commonbusiness.timezone.error.timezone5119 : Unable to find current logged-in user.

500.description: Unable to find the timespan because of a system error.

get.description:
This operation returns the status of an asynchronous Stage Payroll request by request ID.

Possible statuses include:

* __pending__ -- The system has acknowledged the staging request, but it has not yet been processed.

* __in_progress__ -- The staging request is currently being processed.

* __uploaded_on_cloud_storage__ -- The staging request data has been successfully transferred to the cloud storage for further processing.

* __queued__ -- The system has accepted the staging request and placed it in a queue. It will be processed shortly.

* __failed__ -- The processing of the staging request has encountered a failure.

* __queued_failed__ -- Due to the system processing payrolls at its peak capacity, the staging request cannot be queued at the moment. Please try again later.

* __success__ -- The staging request has been completed.

The associated Access Control Point is WAGES.

post.description:
This operation returns a list of all transaction assistant records. The list includes details such as start date and time, end date and time, source type, transaction type, and the integration specific attributes.


The associated Access Control Point is FAILED_TRANSACTION_DATA_BEANS.


Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of days and the number of records in a single page that can be processed in a single request.

  • The Number of Days cannot exceed 7.
  • The Number of Records cannot exceed 500.

requestBody.description: The Retrieve All Transaction Assistant Records request payload.

200.description: Successful retrieval of the list of all transaction assistant records.

Bad Request:

  • [WCO-105000] - The start or end date is not defined.
  • [WCO-105001] - The start date must be earlier than the end date.

403.description: [WFP-90012] - User does not have access to Transaction Assistant Beans with action VIEW.

413.description:
Service Limit:

  • [WCO-105002] - The date-range in the request exceeds the service-limit of {limit} days.
  • [WCO-105003] - The page size exceeds the service limit of {limit}.
